description: From Middle English mayne londe; equivalent to main +‎ land. Compare Scots mayn-land, magan-land, madin-land (“mainland”), Faroese meginland (“mainland”), Icelandic meginland (“mainland”).

entries.meaning: The continent; the principal land, as distinguished from islands or a peninsula.
examples: You may have not realised when I was using the term mainland Europe, I was excluding the British Isles.

entries.meaning: The principal island of a group.
